ModPlusAPI.h57: News is displayed by the auto-update module in a special pop-up window in the lower right corner of the screen. The notification settings are also available in the settings window of the auto-update module
ModPlusAPI.h61: Your version of ModPlus is cracked!
ModPlusAPI.h62: Files modified by third parties were found as part of the ModPlus software! The work of the plugin has been interrupted!

ModPlusAPI.wls5: {0} user access to the license server:
ModPlusAPI.m2: The email address is used as a unique key to identify your data on the server.\nIt is recommended to use the email address you provided when registering on modplus.org
ModPlusAPI.m3: Attention! The use of social networks for authorization is possible only after linking social network accounts to a personal account on the site! Otherwise, when you try to log in through social networks, a new account will be created on the site, and you will lose your license data!
ModPlusAPI.m5: No plugins are connected to the ModPlus platform! Start the Configurator from the ModPlus folder and connect the necessary plugins on the "Configuration" tab, and create a menu on the "Customize" tab
ModPlusAPI.m6: No menu has been created to build the ModPlus tab! Start the Configurator from the ModPlus folder and create a menu on the "Customize" tab
ModPlusAPI.em1: All error information is automatically sent to the ModPlus server, but in most cases we do not have enough information to solve the problem. You can help us by providing additional information. To do this, send us an
ModPlusAPI.em3: or write to our support chat in
ModPlusAPI.em5: Describe in detail what actions caused the error
ModPlusAPI.u2: Log in to your modplus.org account to synchronize h166 purchases with the current version of ModPlus. After authorization, you will be able to use the full versions of the plugins according to your purchased licenses
ModPlusAPI.u3: Failed to connect to ModPlus web services. There may be no internet connection or a proxy is used that is not configured in the ModPlus Configurator. If this computer is supposed to work without access to the internet, you can get an Activation key with data on your licenses. To do this, copy the Registration key listed below and get the Activation key using a special section in your personal account on the website modplus.org
ModPlusAPI.u8: Your account is blocked due to exceeding your seat usage limit! You can log out of all devices, which will clear the list of used computers
ModPlusAPI.u12: Your account information was used on
ModPlusAPI.u14: If your account information is used on more than 3 computers, your account will be blocked automatically!
ModPlusAPI.u15: Log out of the account on this device with a decrease in the number of seats in use
ModPlusAPI.u25: Your account does not have single-user licenses for plugins or subscriptions. Make a purchase on the modplus.org website
ModPlusAPI.u32: Information about single-user licenses and subscriptions
ModPlusAPI.u33: The activation key entered does not match the registration key data
ModPlusAPI.u34: The entered activation key format is invalid – could not get data from the key. Make sure you have entered the activation key completely and that it does not contain spaces
ModPlusAPI.u35: An unexpected error occurred while trying to read data from the entered activation key
ModPlusAPI.u42: In all instances ModPlus, which use your credentials need to re-login to your account
ModPlusAPI.u48: Your account has been blocked by the ModPlus administration. If you think that the blocking is wrong, contact support
ModPlusAPI.u51: Free subscription gives you access to all paid plugins for the selected product (AutoCAD or Revit) for one month.
ModPlusAPI.u52: The free subscription is one-time and is attached to your computer.
ModPlusAPI.u53: Free subscription does not depend on the user account.
ModPlusAPI.u54: If the button to request a free subscription is not available, it means that this computer already has such a subscription on it.
ModPlusAPI.u55: Failed to get a free subscription. Error:
ModPlusAPI.u57: When contacting the support service, please provide the following information:
ModPlusAPI.u58: Pressing the "Logout all devices" button will reset the counter of used computers to zero
ModPlusAPI.u59: Or specify the settings to connect to the license server to use the corporate subscription
ModPlusAPI.nn0: Important news is shown regardless of the settings

ModPlusAPI.nnd6: News about major updates to existing plugins for Renga

Configurator.msg11:
When you added the required data to the AutoCAD configuration file, an error occurred:
{0}
Run the Configurator as administrator and try again.
For more information on modifying the configuration file, see modplus.org in the Help section.
Configuration can still add an entry to the registry to load the ModPlus plug-in, but the plug-in can not earn
Add the registry entry?
Configurator.msg12:
When you added the required data to the Revit configuration file, an error occurred:
{0}
Run the Configurator as administrator and try again.
For more information on modifying the configuration file, see modplus.org in the Help section.
Configuration can still add an entry to the registry to load the ModPlus plug-in, but the plug-in can not earn
Add the registry entry?

AutoUpdater.h3: The configurator needs to be started!
AutoUpdater.h4: You need to start the configurator to update the adaptation menu!
AutoUpdater.h5: Run the update after you close AutoCAD, Revit, or Configurator
AutoUpdater.h6: On the site modplus.org published news
AutoUpdater.h7: In VK group "ModPlus for AutoCad and Revit" a new record was published
AutoUpdater.h9: Do not miss! This can be useful!
AutoUpdater.h11: If you do not have access to the internet, you can install or update the plugin components manually. To do this, you must download the plugin installation files (with the .mpif extension) from modplus.org and use one of the following options:
AutoUpdater.h12: Install or update from the specified .mpif installation file
AutoUpdater.h13: Install or update from the specified folder where the .mpif installation files are located
AutoUpdater.h15: New plugins are available in the ModPlus!
AutoUpdater.h16: Check the plugins in the list that you wish to install
AutoUpdater.h30: Specify the folder in which the ModPlus installation files are located
AutoUpdater.h31: The version of the auto-update module:
AutoUpdater.h36: Do not show notifications if the update contains unimportant changes (bug fixes)
AutoUpdater.h37: An error occurred while sending a request to the ModPlus web service and returned as html. Such errors may indicate a blocking of access by your network
AutoUpdater.h38: Do not show this notification again
AutoUpdater.h42: Plugins will be automatically installed after closing the blocking application (ModPlus Configurator, AutoCAD, Revit or Renga)
AutoUpdater.h48: Show the progress dialog when downloading and installing updates (when you manually start checking for updates, the progress dialog is always shown)
AutoUpdater.h49: Automatically install new plugins (it is recommended to enable rebuilding the standard adaptation menu)
AutoUpdater.h50: Show the update or installation result dialog (when you manually start checking for updates, the result dialog is always shown)
AutoUpdater.h53: This version of the component is installed on your computer
AutoUpdater.h55: This version of the component is not installed on your computer
AutoUpdater.tt1: Check for updates and new plugins
AutoUpdater.tt6: When you check the box, the auto-update module will no longer report the possibility to install this plugin if it is not available. Use the ModPlus Configurator to install the plugins marked with the “Do not remind” flag
AutoUpdater.tt7: Open the location folder of the installed version of ModPlus
AutoUpdater.tt9: Go to the description of the component on the site
AutoUpdater.tt10: Displays a list of ModPlus software components with version information and their current status
AutoUpdater.tt11: Open News related to this update

AutocadDlls.h32: ATTENTION! Do not use blocks with attributes!
AutocadDlls.h38: When you turn on the identification icon for all primitives that have extended data with information about the product, a conditional icon in the form of a blue I-beam will be displayed. The icon is displayed in the upper right corner relative to the rectangle primitive described. The size of the icon changes after regeneration, depending on the size of the visible part of the screen
AutocadDlls.h42: The main settings of the ModPlus plugin – themes, menu on/off, context menu settings for the mini-plugins. It also allows you to find out your registration key without running the Configurator
AutocadDlls.h45: The editor of the fields used to fill in title blocks
AutocadDlls.h53: Add [mpAddVertexToWipeout] and Remove [mpRemoveVertexFromWipeout] vertices of wipeout
AutocadDlls.h62: The editor of the signatures used to fill in title blocks
AutocadDlls.tt2: To work with the modplus.org server, enter your email address. A mail address is required to identify you on the server. It is recommended to use the email address specified at the registration on modplus.org
AutocadDlls.tt3: You must enter your Login in the "Registration" tab! (ModPlus Configurator)
AutocadDlls.tt4: The specified mail address did not pass the verification!\nOr you have made a mistake in specifying the mail address or you have an very unique mail hoster =)
AutocadDlls.tt5: Load plugin in AutoCAD with minimal details on the command line
AutocadDlls.tt8: Enabling/disabling the "Plugins" tab in the palette
AutocadDlls.tt9: Enabling/disabling the "Drawings" tab in the palette
AutocadDlls.tt11: Enable/disable the display of open drawings in the floating menu
AutocadDlls.tt12: Enable/disable the display window of open drawings
AutocadDlls.tt13: Enable/disable the context menu for the mini-plugin "Set Nested Objects to ByBlock"
AutocadDlls.tt14: Enable/disable the context menu for the mini-plugin "Frequently Used Blocks"
AutocadDlls.tt15: Configure a list of frequently used blocks
AutocadDlls.tt16: Enable/disable the context menu for the mini plugin "Viewport boundary in model space"
AutocadDlls.tt17: To change the language in the palette, you need to restart AutoCAD
AutocadDlls.tt18: Enable/disable the context menu for wipeouts, which allows you to add or remove vertices of wipeout
AutocadDlls.tt19: Enable/disable the context menu for the mini-plugin "Set Nested Objects layer"

RevitDlls.name: Name
RevitDlls.h14: Attention! Changing the language on the ribbon will only happen after you restart Revit
RevitDlls.h16: Managing the visibility of tabs on the ribbon
RevitDlls.h41: Search (enter * to display only checked categories)
RevitDlls.h80: Adding commands from ModPlus plugins to the "Favorites" panel
RevitDlls.h83: To add a command to the "Favorites" tab, move it from the "All Commands" list to the "Favorites" list. Move commands in the "Favorite Commands" list to set their order in the panel. Commands that don't have a large icon (the " Tools " plugin) are recommended to be placed one after the other
RevitDlls.h101: Insert parameter key. For shared parameters – parameter GUID, for built-in parameters – system parameter name
RevitDlls.h103: Enables you to open the selected view in a separate tab
RevitDlls.h105: Enables you to select the elements included in the selected Groups
RevitDlls.h106: Enables you to select the elements included in the selected Assemblies
RevitDlls.h107: Enables you to select the elements included in the selected Beam Systems
RevitDlls.h109: Enables you to select the components included in the selected Families
RevitDlls.h111: Enables you to set the Work Plane of the current element as the Work Plane of the current 3D View
RevitDlls.h117: Enables you to select the Rebars included in the selected Structural Area Reinforcement or Structural Path Reinforcement
RevitDlls.h120: Enables you to select an elements that is the Host for the selected elements
RevitDlls.h122: To add a command to the "Favorites" tab, move it from the "All Commands" list to the "Favorites" list. Move commands in the "Favorite Commands" list to set their order in the panel. Small buttons are recommended to be placed one behind the other
RevitDlls.h123: Important: some Revit commands are automatically hidden on the ribbon depending on the current view, currently selected elements, or other conditions
RevitDlls.h125: Enables you to select the elements of the current document referenced by the selected dimensions
RevitDlls.h126: Important: do not add commands placed in the Favorites menu to the Quick Access Toolbar
RevitDlls.h128: Enables you to Reload the Link
RevitDlls.name: Name
RevitDlls.rtw8: L-shaped rebars with a large bend
RevitDlls.rtw10: C-shaped rebars. Hook in the sketch
RevitDlls.rtw12: S-shaped rebars. Hook in the sketch
RevitDlls.r5: Set based on the reinforcement settings
RevitDlls.r12: Name must not contain the following characters:
RevitDlls.r15: Settings will be irrevocably deleted! Are you sure?
RevitDlls.r16: No saved reinforcement settings! First save the settings or use the load from the specified file
RevitDlls.i1: You can enter multiple valid values in the "Values" field, separated by a comma. A parameter is considered to satisfy the condition if its value matches at least one valid value.
RevitDlls.i2: The condition "Presence of parameter" means that the element will be processed if there is such a parameter, regardless of the parameter value.
RevitDlls.i2-1: The condition "Absence of parameter " means that the element will be processed in the absence of such a parameter.
RevitDlls.i3: String parameters are checked only by the conditions "Equal", "Not equal", "Contains", "Not contains".
RevitDlls.i4: Numeric parameters are checked by all conditions except "Contains".
RevitDlls.i5: The "Contains" condition checks that the element parameter contains at least one of the valid values. The condition "Not contains", respectively, checks that the parameter does not contain at least one of the values.
RevitDlls.i5-1: To use the "Starts with" condition, select the "Contains" condition and add an "*" to the end of the value. For example, "Wall*".
RevitDlls.i5-2: To use the "Ends on" condition, select the "Contains" condition and add a "*" at the beginning of the value. For example, "*Wall".
RevitDlls.i5-3: To use the "Not starts with" condition, select the "Not contains" condition and add an "*" to the end of the value. For example, "Wall*".
RevitDlls.i5-4: To use the "Not ends with " condition, select the "Not contains" condition and add a "*" sign to the beginning of the value. For example, "*Wall".
RevitDlls.i7: Parameters of type "on/off" are checked as an integer (0-off, 1-on).
RevitDlls.i8: All simple nested conditions of a group condition are checked with the "AND" operator – i.e. all nested conditions must match.
RevitDlls.i9: Instead of parameter name it is possible to specify GUID for shared parameters or system name for built-in parameters.
RevitDlls.i10: The conditions "Presence of parameter" and "Absence of parameter" when checking the parent Group (keyword Group) check, respectively, whether the element is in the Group or not.
RevitDlls.i11: The conditions "Presence of parameter" and "Absence of parameter" when checking the parent Assembly (keyword Assembly) check, respectively, whether the element is in the Assembly or not.
RevitDlls.tt2: To work with the modplus.org server, enter your email address. A mail address is required to identify you on the server. It is recommended to use the email address specified at the registration on modplus.org
RevitDlls.tt3: You must enter your Login in the "Registration" tab! (ModPlus Configurator)
RevitDlls.tt4: The specified mail address did not pass the verification!\nOr you have made a mistake in specifying the mail address or you have an very unique mail hoster =)
RevitDlls.tt5: To change the language on the Ribbon, you need to restart the Revit

RevitDlls.s1: You are working in an unsaved file. We strongly recommend that you save to avoid losing data in case Revit crashes
RevitDlls.s3: Temporary file detected, which may indicate a Revit crash. Select a further action:
RevitDlls.s4: Restore data from a temporary file
RevitDlls.s9: When opening projects, as well as when they are first saved and saved as, a backup file is created, with the extension os$ (open state). This file will allow you to return to the version of the project at the time it was opened. To do this, change the file extension to the project file extension (.rvt, .rfa or .rte). If no backup storage folder is specified, the file will be created in the same folder as the project file
RevitDlls.s16: The specified folder does not exist!
RevitDlls.s18: If unchecked, the autosave files (with the extension .as$) will be deleted when the project is closed
RevitDlls.s19: Notify if file is not saved
RevitDlls.s20: Show notification about the need to save if the current project is created and never saved

RevitDlls.s26: If a backup storage folder is specified, backup files (files like project_name.nnnn.rvt) and backup folders when working together (folders like project_name_backup) will be moved to the specified folder
RevitDlls.s27: Sets the number of project backups to be moved to the backup storage folder
RevitDlls.s29: Attention! The backup storage folder "{0}" is specified in the settings of the autosave service. This folder is not found - deleted or renamed! Specify a correct folder for storing backups!
RevitDlls.s30: If a backup storage folder is specified, backup files (files like project_name.nnnn.rvt) will be moved to the specified folder
RevitDlls.s31: If a backup storage folder is specified, backup folders when working together (folders like project_name_backup) will be moved to the specified folder

ReinforcementBendRules.t1: SP 63.13330.2018 "SNIP 52-01-2003 Concrete and reinforced concrete structures. Basic provisions", clause 10.3.33
ReinforcementBendRules.t2: EN 1992-1-1 "Eurocode 2: Design of concrete structures – Part 1-1 : General rules and rules for buildings", clause 8.3
ReinforcementBendRules.h4: Fix bend diameters for existing types
ReinforcementBendRules.h5: If the option is enabled and the appropriate types of rebars are found during operation, their bend diameters will be checked and corrected according to the selected standards. If this option is disabled, existing rebar types will not be checked and corrected. When creating new types of rebars, in the case when no suitable ones are found, the bend diameters are always checked and set
ReinforcementBendRules.m5: does not comply with the norms of
ReinforcementBendRules.m6: The minimum value of the bending diameter for the rebar
ReinforcementBendRules.m9: The value of the property will be changed
ReinforcementBendRules.m10: Correcting the bending radius of the rebar
